intro: Geniostoma haemospermum var. rugulosum, commonly known as the bloody sperm plant, is a unique species characterized by its striking red seed-coats. It belongs to the family Cucurbitaceae, which includes cucumbers and melons, and is native to tropical regions of Africa. The plant features palmate leaves with lobed margins and produces yellow flowers that are typically unisexual. Its most notable botanical feature is the vividly colored, blood-red seeds that are enclosed in a fleshy, orange aril.
